settings.title: Wash your hair with Yates MD
settings.subtitle: How to use thickening shampoo

settings.title: Why Yates MD?
settings.info:
2 out of 3 guys will experience hair loss by the age of 35. There is no magic cure for baldness but you can prevent hair loss from happening in the first place. Take action today with our scientific and affordable approach.

  • Less than you’d pay at your local pharmacy
  • Clinically-proven treatments and science-backed formulas
  • Free consultation to ensure your treatment plan is right for you
  • Ongoing support and guidance from a licensed medical provider
  • Shipped and delivered directly to your door

settings.title: Step 1: Prepare Your Hair
settings.text: Ensure your hair is completely dry before applying keratin hair fibers. Avoid using any styling gel or cream prior to application as this can affect how the fibers adhere to your hair.

settings.title: Step 2: Apply the Fibers
settings.text: Gently shake or use an applicator to sprinkle the keratin hair fibers over thinning areas. Start from the back of your head and move forward. Apply sparingly and build gradually to avoid clumping. Aim to disperse the fibers evenly for a natural look. Less is more – you can always add more if needed.

settings.title: Step 3: Pat the Fibers
settings.text: Lightly pat your hair to disperse the fibers throughout the area. This helps the fibers to blend naturally with your existing hair and to bind more securely.

settings.title: Step 4: Clean Up
settings.text: If any fibers land on your forehead or neck, lightly brush them off with a makeup brush or a soft towel. For removal, simply wash your hair with shampoo.

settings.main_description: Because not all vitamins are created equal

settings.description_text: Hair loss can stem from various factors, including genetics, hormonal changes like those during pregnancy or menopause, medical conditions such as alopecia areata, certain medications like chemotherapy, stress-induced telogen effluvium, nutritional deficiencies, damaging hairstyling habits, aging, and environmental factors like pollution and UV radiation. Identifying the underlying cause is crucial for determining the most effective treatment plan, whether it involves medication, lifestyle changes, or specialized therapies. Consulting with a healthcare professional or dermatologist can provide personalized insights and solutions to address hair loss concerns effectively.

settings.label_text: Are these hair products chemical free?
settings.description_text: Yes- Dr Yates Hair Care Products are chemical free.

settings.label_text: Can I use insurance to pay for Yates MD?
settings.description_text: While our treatments are not covered under insurance, our products are available at a fraction of the cost of traditional pharmacies and retailers. We’re dedicated to making it easy and affordable to treat hair loss, which is why many of our treatment plans cost as low as $10/month.

settings.label_text: When can I expect to see results?
settings.description_text: Results may vary depending on the individual's underlying cause of hair loss, overall health, adherence to treatment, and other factors. While some individuals may experience significant improvement or hair regrowth with appropriate interventions, others may see more modest results or may require ongoing management to maintain hair health. It's essential to manage expectations realistically and work closely with healthcare professionals to monitor progress and adjust treatment as needed. Additionally, adopting healthy lifestyle habits and minimizing factors that contribute to hair loss can support the effectiveness of treatment efforts.

For the majority of men, hair loss is caused by a genetic condition called androgenetic alopecia (also known as male pattern baldness). Male pattern baldness accounts for more than 95% of hair loss in men. In some cases, hair loss can be a sign of a more serious medical condition or nutritional deficiency. It is important to consult with a licensed medical professional about any significant hair loss to determine the cause and identify an appropriate solution.

settings.label_text: What is the best medical treatment for hair loss?
settings.description_text: Hair loss caused by male pattern baldness can be treated with two safe and effective formulas—finasteride and minoxidil—which are FDA-approved to treat hair loss. Depending on your condition, your medical provider may recommend one or both treatment options. Some studies indicate that taking finasteride and minoxidil in tandem may be the most effective way to combat hair loss. A Keeps physician can help determine which treatment plan is right for you through a quick consultation.

More than 95% of hair loss in men is caused by a genetic condition called androgenetic alopecia (AKA male pattern baldness). Currently, there is no known cure for male pattern baldness, but there are two FDA-approved treatments that are clinically proven to combat the symptoms of male pattern baldness by preventing hair loss and improving hair regrowth.
